channel.title: Footprints on Embedded Systems Design
channel.description: Recent content in Footprints on Embedded Systems Design

item.title: Creating a custom padstack in Cadence
item.description: Introduction A padstack is a design for the exposed copper surface area for each hole or pad on the board where the component is mounted and soldered (see example, Figure 1).

item.title: Creating a custom PCB footprint manually in Cadence
item.description: Introduction A PCB footprint is the physical layout on a PCB to which a component is soldered.

item.title: Creating a custom PCB footprint using Package Designer in Cadence
item.description: Introduction A PCB footprint is the physical layout on a PCB to which a component is soldered.

item.title: Creating a custom SMD footprint manually in Cadence
item.description: Introduction This tutorial will walk through the creation of a custom surface-mount device (SMD) footprint manually.

item.title: Creating Custom Footprints
item.description: You can try to find existing footprints for components, but most components will require custom footprints.

item.title: Finding existing PCB footprints for Cadence PCB Editor
item.description: Where can I find a list of existing PCB footprints for Cadence PCB Editor?
